department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Chunware; small blue bowl with red/ purple splotch; brown trim on rim; 5/8" wide lip; stored in box with L2004.359.1
markings: on bottom, on sticker: [Andrew Kahane Ltd./ Oriental Art/ New York/ 501]
medium: Chun ware Stoneware with blue glaze and purple markings
text: While Chun ware shapes are usually simple and self-contained, this small, purple-splashed lavender-blue vessel shows how radiant Chun glazes can be. The key glaze ingredient is copper oxide which is fundmental to both the blue and purple colors seen here.
title: Saucer bowl
